ngiemboon: Mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie aláʼ zsé yé na mefàʼ mbòŋo mé, ńcʉa laméndɔ̀ɔn gie à zɔ̌ʼ. Alyɛ̌ʼ gie nyìŋ kwě, áa mbòŋ ńcʉa lyɛ̌ʼ gie mé zyé yé.
en: A good name is better than fine perfume,

ngiemboon: Áa mbòŋ légʉa ndá gie mé ée wó ńdʉa legwé, ńcʉa légʉa ndá gie mé ée wó ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn. Legwɔ́ we nyìŋ mesoŋ zsote pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legwé, á poŋ ngie wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ néŋe ńkímte.
en: It is better to go to a house of mourning

ngiemboon: Áa mbòŋ légẅiin shÿó gẅie é ne ńkwé, ńcʉa lé ne ńgẅe, á nue ngwɔ́ shÿó gú ne ńkwé, ntʉ́m gú gwɔ́ tsoló ńne ńkága.
en: Grief is better than laughter,

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa zsénò kwoŋo légʉa ndá legwé,
en: The heart of the wise is in a house of mourning,

ngiemboon: Áa mbòŋ lézẅíʼte mmó gie nzsènò lɔg ńkaga gú, ńcʉa légwɔ́ nyìŋ mbàŋa gẅie à zẅíʼte zɔ̀bɔ ntse megʉ̀gʉ̀.
en: It is better to listen to rebuke from a wise person

ngiemboon: Legẅe we megʉ̀gʉ̀, aa páʼ nkẅíŋ njǔm gẅie é gwaa shÿó tsìŋe lekʉŋ, ńne ḿvɛ́te, e gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: for like the crackling of burning thorns under the pot,

ngiemboon: Anzsènò gẅie à kuʼu lélɔg metʉ̀ mé ésẅɛ́ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, à gÿo ńcʉ́ʼʉ gʉ̀gʉ̀, membuʼú mie mé kwɛ́ ńnáa mbwó yé, ésele ntʉ́m wé.
en: Surely, the practice of extortion turns a wise person into a fool,

ngiemboon: Nzsòte nò, e poŋ ńcʉa nzyeté, nyìŋ légwɔ́ ngàŋa shÿɔ̀g, á cʉanò ngàŋa ŋáʼtè.
en: The end of a matter is better than its beginning;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn lélwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ, megʉ̀gʉ̀ zɔ̌ lwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ tɛʼ.
en: Don’t let your spirit rush to be angry,

ngiemboon: Tà pege sele ńzɛ́te ngie: ntí kɔ́ njÿó ye njÿê é la poŋ ńcʉa ye fʉ̀ʼɔɔn? Nyìŋ gẅie à zɛ́te púʼu, à te nzsènò wɔ́.
en: Don’t say, “Why were the former days better than these? ”

ngiemboon: Nzẅìŋ gíŋ ńgwɔ́ na zsénò páʼ tÿɔgɔ́ la, ngwɔ́ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ jÿó yé pì mǒ.
en: Wisdom is as good as an inheritance

ngiemboon: Nkáb pɔ́ zsénò gÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́ tsɔ́ menò ntʉtʉ, táʼ, mvfò ké ńgwɔ́ zsénò, á nue á gÿo legwɔ́ we nyìŋ mesoŋ tsẅɛ́.
en: because wisdom is protection as silver is protection;

ngiemboon: Líe mefàʼ Ssé tá ńgyá, ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ kuʼu lépʉʼʉ mmó gie à la gÿo á tʉ́ŋe?
en: Consider the work of God,

ngiemboon: Alyɛ̌ʼ gie ɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ lepòŋ, kága!
en: In the day of prosperity be joyful,   but in the day of adversity, consider: God has made the one as well as the other,  # 7:14 Lm 3:38 so that no one can discover anything that will come after him.

ngiemboon: N da gyá menò ntsèm na mɔ́ɔn melyɛ̌ʼ mie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ fÿɔ́g sẅɛ̀ɛ, ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie aa ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, kwé ńtí nò mbòŋo gie à gÿǒ, wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ piŋ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mé kẅiʼi, ńtí nò tepòŋ gie à gÿǒ.
en: In my futile life   I have seen everything:  # 7:15 Ec 6:12; 9:9 someone righteous perishes in spite of his righteousness,  # 7:15 Ec 8:14 and someone wicked lives long in spite of his evil.  # 7:15 Ec 8:12–13

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn lényɛ ngie ɔ̀ pú ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa nò nénʉ́ tɛʼ, te ké ńnyɛ ngie ɔ̀ zsé nò tà ńzyɛ́ʼ ndège, ɔ̀ ge sele zẅé twó mbùm jú mélàʼakɔ́?
en: Don’t be excessively righteous, and don’t be overly wise.   Why should you destroy yourself?

ngiemboon: Te pú ńgwɔ́ séssé ntʉ́m tɛʼ, te ké ńcʉ́ʼʉ gʉ̀gʉ̀, ɔ̀ ge kwé té lyɛ̌ʼ ńkuʼ mélàʼakɔ́?
en: Don’t be excessively wicked, and don’t be foolish. Why should you die before your time?

ngiemboon: Giŋ páʼ wɔɔn ndùŋmvfò ntÿɔgɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn, te ké ńdege ntÿɔgɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à pɔ́g Ssé, à lɔg pɔ́ mɔɔn mentÿɔgɔ́ mémbʉ́a ńgiŋ.
en: It is good that you grasp the one and do not let the other slip from your hand. For the one who fears God will end up with both of them.

ngiemboon: Azsénò gÿo nyìŋ gẅie aa nzsènò, á pú ńtʉte na lesáʼa láʼ, ńcʉa pangúmnɔ̀ɔn legém pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ.
en: Wisdom makes the wise person stronger

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ zɔɔn te ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa nò nénʉ́ tà ńkuʼu légÿo pɔ́ nò mbòŋo, té gʉa mǒ éfʉa tsɔ́ wɔ́.
en: There is certainly no one righteous on the earth

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn lézẅíʼte meshwóŋè ntsèm mie mé gɔɔn, ḿbɔ́gɔ léjúʼ páʼ nkwɔɔn jù shwóŋe té poŋ na gù.
en: Don’t pay attention   to everything people say, or you may hear your servant cursing you,  # 7:21 Pr 30:10

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ kwaʼ ńzsé na jú twó ngie ɔ̀ lǎ shwóŋe jú té poŋ na petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: for in your heart you know that many times you yourself have cursed others.

ngiemboon: N da lɔgɔ kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́ ńtsaʼa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ésele ńgɔɔn né twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ngie: «N ge giŋ páʼ nzsènò.» Tá ńgÿo púʼu, n te kuʼu lélɔg ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́me wɔ́.
en: I have tested all this by wisdom. I resolved, “I will be wise,” but it was beyond me.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ à kuʼu léjúʼu kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie áa wó? Áa páʼ mmó gie áa tàa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ shú ńkú tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé té lǎŋ.
en: What exists is beyond reach and very deep.   Who can discover it?

ngiemboon: N da pú ńnéŋ ntʉ́m wɔ́ɔn na leziʼí mmó, ḿbiŋ faʼa tsìŋe nò. N da kwoŋo lézsé mmó gie zsénò áa yɛ̌, ḿbiŋ ńkwoŋo lézsé páʼ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwaa gwɔ́ wó ńtí yɛ̌. N da zíʼi, ńgyá ngie legwɔ́ nyìŋ tepòŋ kà légwɔ́ gʉ̀gʉ̀ wɔ́ɔ, aa lépʉ́a.
en: I turned my thoughts to know, explore, and examine wisdom   and an explanation for things, and to know that wickedness is stupidity and folly is madness.

ngiemboon: N da gyá manzwě gẅie à lÿɔgte mbàŋa pɔ́ gwete, à ná ngɔ́ʼ páʼ legwé, eye nkwòŋe ee páʼ lekÿo, mbwó mé gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ menkÿo lɔg ńgwoon nyìŋ. Nyìŋ gẅie à gÿo mmó gie á poŋo mbwó Ssé, à lÿɔ́ʼɔ yé tà ńtsẅɛ́, táʼ nyìŋ gẅie à fʉate menò, á gwe na mbwó mé.
en: And I find more bitter than death   the woman who is a trap:  # 7:26 Pr 6:25 her heart a net and her hands chains. The one who pleases God will escape her, but the sinner will be captured by her.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa zsénò gɔɔn ngie, n da tsaʼ shúm patàʼ patàʼ, lézsé mmó gie é tóo ńtí yɛ̌.
en: “Look,” says the Teacher, “I have discovered this by adding one thing to another to find out the explanation,

ngiemboon: N da láʼ faʼ faʼ, n te tsɔ́ mmó gyá. N da gʉa na mbàŋa tàʼ ntsáʼ, ńgyá ndàʼ tàʼ gẅie aa ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, tá ńgʉa na panzwě metsèm, n te mbɔɔ tàʼ gyá.
en: which my soul continually searches for but does not find: I found one person in a thousand, but none of those was a woman.

ngiemboon: Atwónò yémɔʼɔ́ gie n da gyá, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie e Ssé la gÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ á gwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ, táʼ, epʉ̀a mesoŋ la tó ḿbú ńtɔ́ɔn menò.
en: Only see this: I have discovered that God made people upright,   but they pursued many schemes.”
